metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2019 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's netdevsim device driver, within thescheduling of events. This issue results from the improper management of areference count. This may allow an attacker to create a denial of servicecondition on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic-64k - 5.15.0-53.59
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-53.59').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1021.26').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.27').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.29').
linux-azure-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1020.21~22.04.1').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.29').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.29').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.25').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.12').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.21').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.23').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-53.59').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.28').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.20').
